OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the patient presenting with hypopigmented skin lesions.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports noticing several areas of skin that have become lighter over the past several months. These patches have slowly increased in size. He also mentions that his father has a similar condition. The patient denies any recent illnesses, fever, or previous similar episodes. He is concerned about the cosmetic appearance of these lesions.
Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: No significant past medical history. Not on any medications.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Full-time college student. Non-smoker. Occasional alcohol use.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Denies recent illnesses, fever, weight loss, or other systemic symptoms.

Skin_Examination.Inspection: Multiple well-demarcated, hypopigmented macules and patches over the face, hands, and arms. No erythema or scale. Hair and nails are normal.
Skin_Examination.Palpation: Skin texture is normal within and around the lesions. No warmth or induration.

Skin_Biopsy.Microscopic_Examination: Absence of melanocytes in the epidermis. Normal keratinocyte structure. No evidence of fungal elements.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Assess and diagnose the patient presenting with hypopigmented skin patches.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient reports noticing gradually developing patches of lighter skin on his hands and face over the past few months. These patches seem to be expanding in size. He denies any pain, itching, or other discomfort in the areas. No recent illnesses, medication changes, or significant sunburns.

Secondary_Symptoms: No discomfort in the affected areas
Gradual increase in size of the patches

Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: No significant past medical history. The patient is otherwise healthy with no chronic conditions.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Full-time university student, non-smoker, and occasional alcohol use.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Denies recent flu-like symptoms, fever, weight loss, changes in vision, hair loss, or history of skin cancer in the family.

Skin_Examination.Inspection: Multiple well-demarcated hypopigmented patches on the backs of the hands, face, and neck. No erythema, scaling, or atrophy noted.
Skin_Examination.Palpation: Skin texture feels normal, with no palpable masses or induration. No tenderness.

Histopathology.Findings: Absence of melanocytes in the epidermis.
